summary.para: Gets the given input image by index.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the image to retrieve.

param.name: input
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the image that is identified by Index.

remarks.para: If the input index is out of range, the returned image will be NULL.

summary.para: Gets the number of inputs to the effect.

returns.para: This method returns the number of inputs to the effect.

summary.para: Gets the output image from the effect.

param.name: outputImage
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the output image for the effect.

remarks.para: The output image can be set as an input to another effect, or can be directly passed into the in order to render the effect.
It is also possible to use to retrieve the same output image.

summary.para: Sets the given input image by index.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the image to set.

param.name: invalidate
param.para: Whether to invalidate the graph at the location of the effect input

remarks.para: If the input index is out of range, the input image is ignored.

summary.para: Allows the application to change the number of inputs to an effect.

param.name: inputCount
param.para: The number of inputs to the effect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: One or more arguments are invalid.

remarks.para: Most effects do not support a variable number of inputs. Use with the D2D1_PROPERTY_MIN_INPUTS and D2D1_PROPERTY_MAX_INPUTS values to determine the number of inputs supported by an effect.
If the input count is less than the minimum or more than the maximum supported inputs, the call will fail.
If the input count is unchanged, the call will succeed with S_OK.

Any inputs currently selected on the effect will be unaltered by this call unless the number of inputs is made smaller. If the number of inputs is made smaller, inputs beyond the selected range will be released.
If the method fails, the existing input and input count will remain unchanged.

summary.para: Sets the given input effect by index.
This method gets the output of the given effect and then passes the output image to the method.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the input to set.

param.name: invalidate
param.para: Whether to invalidate the graph at the location of the effect input

summary.para: Represents a basic image-processing construct in Direct2D.

remarks.para: An effect takes zero or more input images, and has an output image. The images that are input into and output from an effect are lazily evaluated. This definition is sufficient to allow an arbitrary graph of effects to be created from the application by feeding output images into the input image of the next effect in the chain.
